Nuxt Kit provides a set of utilities to help you resolve paths. These functions allow you to resolve paths relative to the current module, with unknown name or extension.

Sometimes you need to resolve a paths: relative to the current module, with unknown name or extension. For example, you may want to add a plugin that is located in the same directory as the module. To handle this cases, nuxt provides a set of utilities to resolve paths.
are used to resolve paths relative to the current module.
is used to find first existing file in given paths.
is used to create resolver relative to base path.
Resolves full path to a file or directory respecting Nuxt alias and extensions options. If path could not be resolved, normalized input path will be returned.
language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
async function resolvePath (path: string, options?: ResolvePathOptions): Promise<string>
Options to pass to the resolver. This object can have the following properties:
Resolves path aliases respecting Nuxt alias options.
function resolveAlias (path: string, alias?: Record<string, string>): string
Alias map. If not provided, it will be read from
Try to resolve first existing file in given paths.
A path or an array of paths to resolve.
Type of path to resolve. If set to
, the function will try to resolve a file. If set to
, the function will try to resolve a directory.
Creates resolver relative to base path.

Nuxt Kit provides a set of utilities to help you work with Nitro. These functions allow you to add server handlers, plugins, and prerender routes.
Nuxt Kit provides a set of utilities to help you work with logging. These functions allow you to log messages with extra features.
